poem:
Title: Origami Peace in Pockets of War

Paper cranes folded in tank tracks,
Rubble becomes a playground in Rafah.
Beneath Nuseirat's weeping canvas,
Pieces of young dreams whisper the morning.
Yet the poem of peace is a riddle,
An echo in a refugee camp,
A conversation humming backwards.
In the east, moon meets sun in twilight,
In significant silence, we plea for unraveled aid,
And pray to prophets for a ceasefire's serenade.

This report has not yet been independently verified by the Guardian. 11.32am BST Charity warns that aid operations could". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
